intro: Tragia sellowiana, commonly known as the Brazilian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Tragia sellowiana is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
